title: How to Make Layered Milk Cake

steps.headline: Place your milk cake on a big tray.
steps.description: Smother some frosting or icing over the top of the cake (the more the better)with a spatula.

steps.headline: Slice the top part of the cake with the icing.
steps.description: It should be about 3 centimeters (1.2 in) in length.

steps.headline: Spread some ice cream around the larger bit without icing on the top and around the cake (the more the better) with a spatula.
Place it into another tray and put it in the fridge.
Mix the egg whites, powdered sugar and vanilla in a bowl (along with the marshmallows if you choose to use it.)
Take out the cake in the fridge.
steps.description: Add the slab of cake with the icing on top of the bigger bit with the ice cream.

steps.headline: Spread all of the frothy mixture over the whole cake with a spatula and try to make a rose pattern.
Place the cake in the oven for about 1-5 minutes.
steps.description: The top layer or frothy mixture should turn brown.

steps.headline: Mix the melted chocolate and the strawberries in a bowl.
Take the cake out of the oven and spread the chocolate mixture over the cake's top.
Garnish with 3 raspberries placed in the middle of the cake.
Place the cake in the fridge.
steps.description: Served while the cake is cold.

text: Preheat oven to 350ºF.  Place your milk cake on a big tray. Smother some frosting or icing over the top of the cake (the more the better)with a spatula. Slice the top part of the cake with the icing. It should be about 3 centimeters (1.2 in) in length. Spread some ice cream around the larger bit without icing on the top and around the cake (the more the better) with a spatula.  Place it into another tray and put it in the fridge.  Mix the egg whites, powdered sugar and vanilla in a bowl (along with the marshmallows if you choose to use it.)  Take out the cake in the fridge. Add the slab of cake with the icing on top of the bigger bit with the ice cream. Spread all of the frothy mixture over the whole cake with a spatula and try to make a rose pattern.  Place the cake in the oven for about 1-5 minutes. The top layer or frothy mixture should turn brown. Mix the melted chocolate and the strawberries in a bowl.  Take the cake out of the oven and spread the chocolate mixture over the cake's top.  Garnish with 3 raspberries placed in the middle of the cake.  Place the cake in the fridge. Served while the cake is cold.
